question: [File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Integration] [process_certificates during insert] If process_certificates() is called while insert_vote() is aggregating votes, can the round transition discard a forming QC? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Integration] [Timeout loop] Can calling process_local_timeout() immediately followed by setup_timeout() create an infinite timeout loop if the timeout duration is very short? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Integration] [Multiple verifiers] If different ValidatorVerifier instances are passed to insert_vote() and insert_round_timeout(), can this cause signature verification inconsistencies? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [Round 0 handling] When current_round is 0 and process_certificates() is called with new_round=1, are all state transitions correct for the genesis->round 1 transition? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [u64::MAX round] If current_round reaches u64::MAX - 1 and sync_info.highest_round() is u64::MAX, does new_round calculation at line 254 handle overflow correctly? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [Zero timeout] If get_round_duration() returns Duration::from_millis(0), can this cause immediate timeout triggering in an infinite loop? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [Negative time delta] In setup_deadline() at line 378, if system clock is adjusted backwards, can checked_sub fail repeatedly, hiding actual timeout expiry? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [Same round QC and TC] If sync_info contains both a QC and TC for round R, which one determines new_round at line 254? Can this cause round calculation errors? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [Empty verifier] Can an empty ValidatorVerifier be passed to insert_vote() or insert_round_timeout(), causing all votes to be accepted without validation? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [Ordered round > current round] If highest_ordered_round somehow becomes greater than current_round, does setup_deadline() calculation at line 364 handle this correctly? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [Multiplier 0] If setup_timeout(0) is called, does this create a zero-duration timeout that triggers immediately? Is this ever a valid scenario? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [Very large exponent_base] If ExponentialTimeInterval is created with exponent_base=1000.0, even with max_exponent=10, can this cause extremely long timeouts that halt the network? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Edge case] [Fractional exponent_base] If exponent_base < 1.0 (e.g., 0.5), do timeouts decrease exponentially instead of increase? Is this ever intended? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Crypto] [Aggregate signature verification] At line 266, unpack_aggregate() unpacks signatures - are there timing side channels in the verification that could leak validator private keys? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Crypto] [Verifier epoch mismatch] Can votes from epoch N be validated with a verifier from epoch N+1, accepting votes from removed validators? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Crypto] [HashValue collisions] prev_round_votes uses HashValue as key at line 49 - can hash collisions cause different blocks to be treated as the same? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Safety] [Double sign prevention] Does record_vote() check if a vote for a different block at the same round was already recorded? Can this allow local equivocation? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Safety] [Round monotonicity] Is there an invariant that current_round only increases? Can any sequence of calls cause current_round to decrease, violating safety? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Liveness] [Timeout escalation] After multiple process_local_timeout() calls, should the multiplier increase? Current hardcoding to 1 may prevent progress. (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Liveness] [Stuck round] If all validators have different current_round values due to message delays, can the network get stuck unable to form QCs? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Liveness] [Timeout starvation] If process_certificates() is called repeatedly before timeout tasks fire, can this prevent timeout certificates from forming? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Safety] [Vote equivocation storage] When pending_votes.drain_votes() is called at line 256, are equivocating votes detected and stored for slashing evidence? (High)
[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Memory] [PendingVotes growth] Does PendingVotes have bounded size? Can memory grow unbounded if votes are received faster than rounds progress? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Memory] [Clone cost] Vote and RoundTimeout are cloned in vote_sent() and timeout_sent() - do these types contain large embedded data that makes cloning expensive? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/round_state.rs] [Memory] [Timeout task accumulation] If abort_handle.abort() at line 352 doesn't immediately stop the task, can timeout tasks accumulate in the time service? (Medium)
